cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: eye moving over the Camagüey Archipelago of Cuba, about 85 miles ESE of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later today, then track near the Florida Keys Sunday morning and up the southwest coast of Florida while its expansive wind field impacts the entire peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / southwest coast of Florida

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach and north and west of Anclote River to Indian Pass (Hurricane Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River, including Lake Okeechobee and Florida Keys (Hurricane Warning area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida Atlantic coast including Palm Beach County, the Florida Keys, and the whole Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (85% chance) with a 42% chance of sustained 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday as the storm passes to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible from Boca Raton northward past the port; locally higher in on-shore flow zones.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with locally up to 20 inches expected across the Florida peninsula, including Palm Beach County, bringing risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents will hamper port operations and evacuations.
